result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Defendant Gregory A Schwartz in court.  Attorney Aaron Thomas Vruwink in court for Gregory A Schwartz.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. Not guilty pleas are entered. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court appoints Attorney Aaron Vruwink as counsel - Defendant must pay $50.00 per month toward attorney fees commencing November 1, 2022.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM Defendant Gregory A Schwartz in court.  Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Pederson is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being the Chief of Police with the Grand Rapids Police Department. Testifies to being dispatched to a traffic accident. Testifies to the witnesses on scene that observed what has taken place. Testifies to another officer arriving on scene before him. Testifies to viewing the squad footage from the other officer. Testifies to the defendant being the driver of the vehicle. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to making contact w/ the defendant to find out what happened. Testifies to his observations of the defendant. Testifies to the defendant stating he had been drinking. Testifies to the defendant refusing any field sobriety tests and taking the PBT. Testifies to taking the defendant to the hospital to get blood drawn and having to get a warrant for it. Testifies to not getting the results of the blood test yet. Testifies to the defendants prior OWI arrests. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. 

Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Petition to revoke Huber/Work release w/ Wood County Jail Incident Report
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Must wear alcohol monitor. $2500
Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Must wear alcohol monitor.

1:42 PM Defendant Gregory A Schwartz appeared by video, in custody. 
Bond hearing was heard yesterday and bond was reduced and was required to wear an alcohol monitor. Before the monitor was put on defendant, he tested positive for benzo. Defendant does not know why the drug is in his system.
Court modifies bond to $2500.00 cash bond. Absolute sobriety. Must wear alcohol monitor. May ask for bond modification again in 30 days.
Absolute sobriety, Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Must have ankle monitor. $1000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on October 3, 2022 at 11:15 am.
